newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: AUSTRALIAN EXPLORERS INDEX DOWN AS GOLD WEAKENS.
newsitem.headline: AUSTRALIAN EXPLORERS INDEX DOWN AS GOLD WEAKENS.

text.p: Perth stockbroker Eyres Reed Ltd said its Australian Explorers Index dropped 104.3 points or 3.64 percent last week. The All Ordinaries Index fell 0.59 percent.
Aug 8 Aug 1 pct 1 Month pct 1 Year pct
NOTE: The explorers index (base 500, March 1992) tracks the performance of 88 small capitalisation exploration companies.
The index, which reversed the previous week's 103.1 point rise, was not helped by a further fall in the price of gold, Eyres Reed analyst Martin Angel said.
Stocks that moved against the trend included Lone Star Exploration NL, which rose five cents to 29 cents on speculation of drilling results.
Precious Metals Australia Ltd were up seven cents to 32 cents, Crest Resources Australia NL were up 2.5 cents to 9 cents while Julia Mines were up three cents to 14 cents.
Angel said there was little to inspire the explorers index last week with no news on exploration.
"The only stocks to really have any movement were the Junior Oil's which moved in line with a very strong oil market," he said.
